Name: Mallet of stone carving
Description: Stone was worked using bronze and copper chisels (see for example E.2480 and E.2543) and wooden mallets. This example (see also E.1106, E.4414 and E.4416) is a mallet with a pear-shaped head (compare with the elongated type; E.4333) and was used for heavy work, particularly in the quarries, that is, the roughing out of the basic shape and the hollowing out of dishes. There are traces of use around the middle of the head caused by hammering on the chisels.
